title: 4 Quick Steps to Turn Off Switch Control on an iPhone

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings. This is the gray gear icon on your Home screen. If you don't see it, it may be found in a folder labeled “Utilities.” If you aren’t in the main menu of Settings, you will need to get there by tapping the back arrow in the upper-left corner of your screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap "Accessibility."
steps.content: Scroll down and tap "Accessibility." This option displays all of your Accessibility settings.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap " Switch Control."
steps.content: Scroll down and tap " Switch Control." It’s in the third set of options. The on/off switch appears here.

steps.title: Toggle the switch to Off.
steps.content: Toggle the switch to Off. Tap the "Switch Control" toggle switch to turn it off (gray). This will disable your phone’s ability to use Switches as an alternative navigation function.
